#plt.plot
plt.plot(x,y,'m*',linestyle = 'dotted', markersize = 12)
plt.xlabel('X-axis')
plt.ylabel('Y-axis')
plt.title('Plot')
plt.show()
source.034ada40:
plt.subplot(2,2,1)
plt.plot(x,y,'b--')
plt.subplot(2,2,2)
plt.plot(x,y,'g*')
plt.subplot(2,2,3)
plt.plot(x,y,'ro')
plt.subplot(2,2,4)
plt.plot(x,y,'m*-')
plt.show()
source.09be2e98:
x = np.arange(0,10)
y = 2*x+10
plt.plot(x,y,'bo')
plt.xlabel('X-axis')
plt.ylabel('Y-axis')
plt.title('Plot')
plt.show()
source.ad6885ae:
x = np.arange(0,np.pi*10,0.1)
y = np.sin(x)
plt.plot(x,y)
plt.xlabel('X-axis')
plt.ylabel('Y-axis')
plt.title('Sine curve')
plt.show()
source.4d5a6651:
#subplot
x = np.arange(0,10*np.pi,0.1)
y_sin = np.sin(x)
y_cos = np.cos(x)

plt.subplot(2,1,1)
plt.plot(x,y_sin,'b--')
plt.title('Sine curve')

plt.subplot(2,1,2)
plt.plot(x,y_cos,'g--')
plt.title('Cosine curve')
plt.show()
source.32086407:
x = [1,5,3,2,7,9]
y = [100,450,200,375,600,150]
plt.bar(x,y)
plt.title('Bar Graph')
plt.xlabel('X-axis')
plt.ylabel('Y-axis')
plt.show()

a = np.array([10,34,25,67,13,57,98,65,42,76,43,21,34,10])

source.d22ccd3b:
data = [np.random.normal(0,std,100) for std in range(1,4)]
plt.boxplot(data, vert=True, patch_artist=False)
plt.show()
source.1b2522bf:
labels = 'Python','C++','Java','Ruby'
sizes = [300,250,275,150]
colors = ['gold','yellowgreen','lightcoral','lightskyblue']
explode = (0.1,0,0,0)

plt.pie(sizes, labels=labels, colors = colors, explode=explode, autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True)
plt.show()
source.dced586e:
Matplotlib is a plotting library for the Python programming language and its numerical mathematics extension NumPy. It provides an object-oriented API for embedding plots into applications using general-purpose GUI toolkits like Tkinter, wxPython, Qt, or GTK+.

Some of the major Pros of Matplotlib are:

Generally easy to get started for simple plots
Support for custom labels and texts
Great control of every element in a figure
High-quality output in many formats
Very customizable in general
